title: Okay. Where are the Miss fortune changes?
body: I'm talking about the ones from here http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/VoN7EBfm-riotrepertoir-follow-up-on-miss-fortune  that were teased. I was kind of hoping they'd be out before Worlds patch just for the slight chance they're good; Mf might be somebody's pocket pick. (but that's really doubtful)  Overall, I'm just wondering if I can expect them earlier or more like preseason.

MF isn't the aoe wombo adc though.  That's Graves, as shown by his two burst true aoe abilities(abilities that can hit an entire team).  He also has a dash to set up that combo, and the relatively low sustained auto attack damage to support that paradigm.  Maybe MF was intended to be this at release(though all the marketing around her was about her lane bully nature and the fact she was a pirate not that she was some aoe juggernaut), but that hasn't been her identity in a very very long time.  Kogmaw is more of an aoe adc(2 long range powerful aoe nukes) than she is and he's a character known for his single target damage.  Even Ez's ult is often more damaging than bullet time for a fraction of the risk.

MF meanwhile has skirmish movement, high sustained auto attack damage(some of the highest, though not the best), and some rather wonky aoe spells that are often better to just not use because they do less than just pressing impure shots for attack speed and autoattacking.  Double up is her defining spell, and the lane bullying that is supposed to go with it, but it's an archaic design that's a hold over from ADC mids and has been gutted so bad because of that that it's now actually bad to cast once you have items.  

On a side note, I'm not sure that making a class that is all about movement and auto attacking have an ability that is about standing still and not auto attacking is all that great of a design to begin with.  The other channeled adc ult, Lucian's, basically just simulating auto attacking and letting you move during it sorta demonstrates this fact.

_**"I want MF to be considered as a top tier ADC"**_

As Scruffy already noted, every champion has it's own **identity**.
For example: **tower buster** (Tristana), **AoE team killer** (Jinx), **tank buster** (Vayne), **poke** (Ezreal)... If you share the same item path, you can deduct that the output damage should be the same across all these champions but that their unique identity (their specialization) is what sets them apart from the rest and what should be relevant when you want to build a team accordingly.

IF a champion's "risk vs reward" system is not balanced properly, any favor on one side can determine the champ to be either "too good to pass on" or "not even worth mentioning" pick.
A good way to look at this is if you think about certain champions who were top tier picks or banned almost every game.
**I think that Kassadin should ring the biggest bell in our heads but everyone else has their own bane of their soloq existance.**

The problem is that she doesn't have the item synergy almost every other adc has built into their kit. Like Vayne with Botrk, Ashe with IE, Cait with IE, Ez and Corki with Trinity, etc. 

So she just doesn't get great power spikes, and that puts her at a disadvantage in lane when other adcs grossly overpower during several windows throughout the game. My opinion is that they need to rework {{item:3508}} alongside her since it's **soooooo** close to being a great item on her. If it just had some more CDR or built out of Sheen or something, it could be a great first-item spike.

Another interesting idea I had for {{item:3508}} that would work as an interesting idea for MF is for it to grant AP in some form. A few various iterations:

1) Grants X% of AD as AP based on scaling. So for MF, her E scales only off AP, so the ratio is a high 80%. Using E would apply 80% of her AD as AP. This could be capped at a certain percentage.

2) Toggle that converts AD x 1.5 to AP. Basic attacks cancel the toggle and trigger a 10 second item CD.

3) AAs stack a buff that grants X% of AD as AP. Each ability cast consumes a stack. Power could easily be modulated by adjusting the number of AAs to build a stack, number of stacks, causing stacks to degrade to minimum of 1 if not consumed, etc. 

4) Grant a % of stolen mana as AP for X seconds, consumed on ability use.

However, her AOE damage output is too low. I sincerely hope Miss Fortune's next update has her Marskman role as the priority because I do not care about her AP Mage outlier role if it's going to water down her ADC effectiveness.
